90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:07): Problem:  I've got a server listening for udp data from an ip, but which could be from any port, so I set the remote endpoint to TheIPAddress, 0.  I get data from the remote computer, but my problem is I need to send data back to that computer on the port it sent the data from... But since the remote endpoint port is '0' that's the port I get when I check the remote endpoint property
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:07): Any suggestions?
9351c00f73660c0a9076d185506e355f (14:07): well, you are checking wrong endpoint
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:08): Ehh, they have to come back some day, and there's a little hope they'll read my question :)
9351c00f73660c0a9076d185506e355f (14:08): you check your endpoint - 0
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:08): My local endpoint is set to 9599, which is what the remote computer will -always- send to...
9351c00f73660c0a9076d185506e355f (14:09): are you talking about ports?
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:09): Yep
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:09): Sorry, my local endpoint *port* is set to 9599
9351c00f73660c0a9076d185506e355f (14:09): dont check the listening socket
9351c00f73660c0a9076d185506e355f (14:10): check the socket that has been accepted by the listening socket
9351c00f73660c0a9076d185506e355f (14:10): it will have proper ip adresses and port numbers
9351c00f73660c0a9076d185506e355f (14:10): (at least that is how it is done in POSIX)
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:10): It's a UDP socket, I wasn't aware I needed to accept a connection, since it's a connectionless protocol.  Apparently I did it wrong...
9351c00f73660c0a9076d185506e355f (14:11): i didnt read your message carefully ;p
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:11): In short, I've got:  m_RemoteEP = New IPEndpoint(IPAddress.Any, 0):  m_UDP.Connect(m_RempoteEP)
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:12): Sets the remote endpoint, is all...  At least the tooltip says as much
9351c00f73660c0a9076d185506e355f (14:13): http://www.c-sharpcorner.com/Network/simpleTcpUdpServerClientPL2.asp
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (14:17): else  if  ((argv[0] == "TCP") || (argv[0] == "tcp"))
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:18): pks:  I assume I can adapt this to use async sockets with BeginReceiveFrom and EndReceiveFrom without problems?
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:21): Ehh, apparently not.  Now I'm not receiving any UDP data at all
90fe42a2aeeedf2aa3eab34ffb5fc032 (14:21): *undo* *undo* *undo*
